title: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Soft and chewy chocolate chip cookies with crispy edges, just like grandma used to make

steps.instruction: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.
In a large bowl, beat butter and both sugars together until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes.
steps.tips: Don't skip this step - it creates air pockets for soft cookies

steps.instruction: Beat in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla extract.
Gradually add flour mixture to wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Fold in chocolate chips.
steps.tips: Don't overmix or cookies will be tough

steps.instruction: Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto prepared baking sheets, spacing 2 inches apart. Sprinkle with flaky salt if desired.
steps.tips: Chill dough for 30 minutes for thicker cookies

steps.instruction: Bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are golden but centers still look slightly underdone.
steps.tips: They'll firm up as they cool!

steps.instruction: Let cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack.

notes: Dough can be frozen for up to 3 months. Bake from frozen, adding 2-3 minutes to bake time.

title: Classic Italian Tiramisu
description: Layers of espresso-soaked ladyfingers and creamy mascarpone, dusted with cocoa

steps.instruction: Combine cooled espresso and coffee liqueur in a shallow dish. Set aside.
steps.tips: Make sure espresso is completely cool or it will melt the cream

steps.instruction: In a heatproof bowl over simmering water, whisk egg yolks and sugar until thick and pale, about 8 minutes. Remove from heat.
steps.tips: The mixture should reach 160°F for food safety

steps.instruction: Let egg mixture cool to room temperature. Fold in mascarpone cheese until smooth.
In a separate bowl, whip heavy cream and vanilla to stiff peaks. Gently fold whipped cream into mascarpone mixture.
steps.tips: Fold gently to keep it light and airy

steps.instruction: Quickly dip each ladyfinger in coffee mixture (don't soak!) and arrange in a single layer in a 9x13 inch dish.
steps.tips: Just a quick dip - soggy ladyfingers ruin the texture

steps.instruction: Spread half the mascarpone cream over the ladyfingers. Repeat with another layer of dipped ladyfingers and remaining cream.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight.
steps.tips: This allows the flavors to meld and the ladyfingers to soften perfectly

steps.instruction: Before serving, dust generously with cocoa powder and garnish with shaved chocolate if desired.
steps.tips: Dust just before serving so cocoa stays dry

notes: Best made 24 hours ahead. Keeps refrigerated for up to 3 days.
